meanings.definition: Familiar with something through experience or repetition.
meanings.sent1: She was accustomed to the daily routine of walking her dog.
meanings.sent2: The old cat was accustomed to the warm sun on the porch.
meanings.sent3: The dog, accustomed to his owner's whistle, came running happily.
meanings.sent4: The tree, accustomed to the wind's gentle sway, stood tall and strong.
meanings.sent5: The child, accustomed to her mother's lullabies, fell asleep peacefully.

meanings.definition: In the habit of doing something regularly.
meanings.sent1: He was accustomed to taking a morning jog before work.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was accustomed to waking up early to tend to his crops.
meanings.sent3: The bird was accustomed to singing loudly at dawn, much to the neighbors' delight.
meanings.sent4: The clock was accustomed to ticking rhythmically throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The student was accustomed to studying diligently for exams.

meanings.definition: Used to something as a normal part of one's routine.
meanings.sent1: She was accustomed to having her morning coffee with a book.
meanings.sent2: The family was accustomed to gathering around the dinner table every evening.
meanings.sent3: The cat was accustomed to curling up by the fireplace on chilly nights.
meanings.sent4: The car was accustomed to the daily commute to work.
meanings.sent5: The child was accustomed to bedtime stories before sleep.
